page.title: 02PEOPLE & JOBS IN TYWARDREATH
page.content: The{population}of the area is very centred around Tywardreath. There is a mixture of age ranges. There are older people in the village, in fact in 1905 "The Illustrated Mail" wrote an article about the amazing ages that people lived until in Tywardreath, but these are balanced by the middle-aged and young. The {main employment}of the area is working in some capacity for the China Clay firm of {English China Clay,} either at the clay pits, at their offices in St. Austell or at Par Docks, where ships come from all over the world to collect china clay. {Farms}cover a large section of our area but they do not employ many people. A few work for {British Rail} which has a station at Par, others work in the {village shops}or in St. Austell, Truro or Fowey.
